message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,200,000. This is a great deal for both of us, as it's well below the value I place on it and still leaves you with a solid profit margin. Let's get this deal done!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,000,000. This is my top price for the product.

Bob, I understand your position, but $1,000,000 just isn't workable for me. I'm willing to come down to $1,150,000. This is still a great deal for you, considering the value of the product. Let's find a middle ground and close this deal.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still a bit far from your asking price. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $1,050,000. This is my final offer.

Bob, I understand your position, but $1,050,000 simply doesn't work for me.  I'm willing to come down to $1,100,000.  This offer represents a substantial compromise from my initial position, and it still leaves you with a good profit margin.  Let's find a solution that benefits both of us.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still not comfortable going above $1,050,000. This is my final offer.
